definition: Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
surname Huang or Hwang
yellow/pornographic/to fall through
main hall/front courtyard/law court
strong/solid/firm/unyielding/resolute

sentences.english: All of these artistic characteristics distinguishes him from his contemporary poets.
sentences.chinese: 這是黃庭堅區別於其他詩人的藝術特徵。

sentences.english: Besides, some of Huang Tingjian slate works succeeded in learning Taos style.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，晚年的黃庭堅也確有一些學陶的成功之作。

sentences.english: Huang Tingjian is highly of Taoist complex, and his poetic taste comes from his carrying forward the Taoist tradition.
sentences.chinese: 黃庭堅的詩歌趣味來源於對道教傳統的繼承。

definition: Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
Zhang Xu (probably early 8th century), Tang dynasty poet and calligrapher, most famous for his grass script 草書|草书
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
Liu Gongquan (778-865), Tang calligrapher
Ouyang Xun (557-641), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
grass script/cursive script (Chinese calligraphic style)
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Wang Wei (701-761), Tang Dynasty poet
Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
short comments/preface and postscript
Ma Zhiyuan (c. 1250-1321), Yuan dynasty dramatist in the 雜劇|杂剧[za2 ju4] tradition of musical comedy, one of the Four Great Yuan Dramatists 元曲四大家[Yuan2 qu3 Si4 Da4 jia1]
running script/semicursive script (Chinese calligraphic style)

notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old)/a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
Zeng Gong (1019-1083), Song dynasty writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家
